title: M&S worker holds restless baby for mother as he works | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Babysitting is not usually in the job spec of a supermarket cashier - but this employee went the extra mile as the mother he was serving struggled with her noisy child. Mother-of-one Lauren Walker was buying her food at the M&S food hall in Uddingston, Glasgow, when her son, Alistair Findlay, began crying his eyes out. Ms Walker struggled to calm the youngster and was on the verge of leaving the store, until a worker named Mubarak Ahmad came to her rescue. Having helped her with her shopping earlier in her visit, Mr Ahmad had now taken up position on the tills and was waiting to provide further assistance. He took Alistair off her hands and held him in one arm as he scanned Ms Walker's items through with the other. And the youngster was engrossed with the beeping on the checkout, as he watched Mr Ahmad at work. Ms Walker, from Motherwell, told the Daily Record : 'Thanks to Mubarak, he really made my shopping experience much more enjoyable. It really just seemed second nature to him to help in this way and, to be honest, Mubarak Ahmad took Alistair off her hands and held him in one arm as he scanned Ms Walker's items through with the other Lauren Walker pictured with her son Alistair Findlay, who began crying his eyes out at an M&S store in Glasgow 'Alistair wasn't impressed when it was time to leave and he was handed back to me.' Since she posted the video on Facebook this weekend, it has been liked more than 7,000 times. Mr Ahmad added: 'Chatting to customers and helping make a difference where I can is the bit of my job I enjoy the most.' Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
